results.title: Circus
results.brief_description: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Place Across the River
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: Explore the rich history of Melbourne through the National Gallery of Victoria site in St Kilda Road, Melbourne, via its various uses, as a circus site in 1887 to the landmark cultural centre it became. Mixes found footage, stills and contemporary footage.

results.title: Circus nomads
results.creator_credit: David Hughes, Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This film aims to portray the circus as a nomadic way of life, to give viewers a deeper insight into aspects of circus life, and to show the circus as a form of theatre where the clown is king.

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Part one begins with the evolution of the kangaroo, tracing its development into over 50 species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “big red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied. Narrated by Lionel Long.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Walker, John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Careers in building
results.creator_credit: Bruce McNaughton, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: A vocational guidance film on the building industry. Shows the erection of a tall city office block; the men and women of the building industry at work in their diverse activities; the craftsmanship and skill required to erect a typical Australian brick veneer home; the development of a new airline terminal; and the construction work involved in a guided missile rocket pad.

results.title: Boys in the age of machines
results.creator_credit: Giorgio Mangiamele, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the many opportunities available today in the field of engineering. Shows a typical machine-shop where a young apprentice follows the production of a pattern from the drawing board design to the casting being finished in the dressing shop. Outlines various diploma and degree courses; employment opportunities based on educational qualifications; preliminary subjects required in basic education.

results.title: The Bristol school
results.creator_credit: Nancy Hamilton, E.J. Perry and Victoria. Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description:
A look at the Victorian Department of Education’s work in importing 100 pressed aluminium building from Bristol, England. These buildings can be erected in 2 days and will provide accommodation of 8,000 students in an attempt to overcome overcrowding within Victorian schools.

The construction process is shown with one being assembled in the Melbourne University grounds near the Melbourne Teacher’s College.

The film print from which the digital copy was made was badly damaged and the digital version shows evidence of that.
